text: Val Buëch-Méouge is a commune in the Hautes-Alpes department. The municipality was created on 1 January 2016 and consists of the former communes of Ribiers (the seat), Châteauneuf-de-Chabre and Antonaves.Arrêté préfectoral 27 August 2015 == References == Category:2016 establishments in France Category:Communes in Hautes-Alpes
title: Val Buëch-Méouge
